body.p:
We’ve all seen it - letters that are typed from the dictation machine not quite as we had intended. Some of these secretarial bloomers can be quite amusing. Here are a few that we have collected over the past year.
‘The patient has been much better since we started her on asthma nailers'
‘I would be grateful if you would consider removing a 1.2 m diameter pigmented lesion that has appeared on Mr X’s nose’
‘This lady has been complaining of instrumental bleeding for several months'
‘The ultrasound showed no pee fluid in the pelvis'
‘This patient has a very stubborn anal fisher'
‘Although one of our GPs did manage to inject her right shoulder excessively, her neck pain persists'
‘I would be grateful if you would arrange nerve conduction studies for this 72 year old lady who is profoundly dead’
‘Mrs X has a large sister seal’
If you come across any secretarial bloomers in your practice, please send them to InnovAiT and (if they are good enough and not offensive in any way) we will publish them on our blog.
